channel.title: Apple on Preslav Rachev
channel.description: Recent content in Apple on Preslav Rachev

item.description: Apple is becoming a macOS gatekeeper too. For the past 35 years, any Mac developer who wanted to ship an update directly to customers could do so by recompiling a binary and distributing it. When macOS 10.15 ships this fall, the status quo will change. Mac developers must register with Apple and sign their products. They must submit their binaries to Apple for notarization. And most significantly of all, they must agree to the terms of Appleâ€™s App Store developer contracts, even if they donâ€™t distribute their apps through the App Store.

Q: Aesthetically, what do you think about the design of the new grater? A: It has been optimized for softer cheeses ðŸ˜‚ 329: Mac Pro Day â€” Accidental Tech Podcast â€” Overcast Our live show from WWDC 2019! Source: - Overcast

Apple introduced on Tuesday a new line of MacBook Pros with supposedly, a more durable keyboard, and the latest gen Intel chips. The 15’ version features an 8-Core CPU and up to 32 GB of RAM and up to 4 TB SSD. It’s a beast with an incredible performance:
Have no illusions however. All this power comes at a cost. An what a cost! I went to the Apple website and configured myself a top-of-the-line MBP with all the specs pushed to the max.
